Subjective: Dizziness for 3 days. Woke up with dizziness. Room spinning. Light-headed. Nauseous. No vomiting. No headache. No hearing loss. No speech difficulties. No loss of function. No heart palpitations. Recent cold. No smoking/alcohol/drugs. Social: Lives alone. ICE (Concern): Worried about brain tumor (friend's diagnosis).
Objective: BP: 110/70. Pulse: 62/min. Neurological exam: Normal facial sensation, normal eye movements, normal muscle strength. HIT test negative. Epley maneuver provoked symptoms.
Assessment: Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV). Ruled out: Brain tumor.
Plan: 1. Epley maneuver to be performed in office. 2. Instructions for self-performance via thuisarts.nl. 3. Follow-up as needed.
